summary: The term "directly-elected chamber" refers to a legislative body within the European Union that is composed of representatives elected directly by the electorate. This concept is pivotal in the context of EU governance, as it embodies the principle of democratic legitimacy. The directly-elected chamber plays a crucial role in the legislative process, influencing the formulation and adoption of EU laws and policies. This chamber is integral to fostering a participatory democracy in the EU.
